name: Aisha Ali
life_stage: Living with roommates, always the one suggesting where to go
relevant_history: Rates everything mentally on a 1-10 scale but has no record of it.
emotional_baseline: Slightly overwhelmed by how much they've done with no system
in_their_voice: Every time I try a new app it wants me to write reviews. I just want to rate and move on.

name: Ezra Chen
life_stage: Freelancer with flexible schedule, eats out 4-5 times a week
relevant_history: Screenshots menus and flyers but never looks at them again.
emotional_baseline: Content overall but feels like their effort tracking things goes to waste
in_their_voice: I wish I had a resume of everywhere I've been and what I thought.

name: Daniela O'Brien
life_stage: Living alone in a walkable neighborhood, spends weekends exploring
relevant_history: Used to blog about experiences, burned out on writing long posts.
emotional_baseline: Reflective — starting to realize they can't remember last year's highlights
in_their_voice: I'm the person with opinions about everything but no organized way to share them.

name: Kai Franklin
life_stage: Settled into their city, built strong restaurant and bar routines
relevant_history: Used a Google Sheet with columns for vibe, food, price. Maintained it for 6 months, then stopped updating.
emotional_baseline: Eager for something that respects the way they already think
in_their_voice: I literally keep a spreadsheet. I know that's insane but nothing else works.

name: Diego Larsson
life_stage: Working in creative industry, taste is part of professional identity
relevant_history: Has a 200-entry Notes app list organized by neighborhood. Works but unsearchable.
emotional_baseline: Calm, methodical — would adopt the right tool instantly if it existed
in_their_voice: My friends trust my taste but I forget half the places I've been.

name: Isaiah Singh
life_stage: Recently got a raise and upgrading how they spend free time
relevant_history: Sends voice notes to themselves after good meals. Has 80+ never listened to again.
emotional_baseline: Mildly annoyed that no tool matches how they think about experiences
in_their_voice: I want something that just knows what I like without me writing paragraphs.

name: Malachi Kim
life_stage: Single, treats dining and experiences as their main hobby
relevant_history: Has a private Twitter/X account where they post mini-reviews. Disorganized.
emotional_baseline: Confident in their taste but aware they forget good experiences
in_their_voice: My Notes app has like 300 lines of restaurants and I still can't find what I need.

name: Nia Adeyemi
life_stage: Moved back to hometown, rediscovering it with new perspective
relevant_history: Tried Yelp bookmarks for a year, stopped because it mixed their taste with strangers' reviews.
emotional_baseline: Proud of their taste but wishes they could share it more easily
in_their_voice: I know what I like but I have no way to show someone my actual taste.

name: Leila Williams
life_stage: Just finished grad school, finally has money to match their taste
relevant_history: Tried Beli for restaurants, loved the concept, wished it covered more than food.
emotional_baseline: Excited by the idea of a taste profile but skeptical it'll be worth the effort
in_their_voice: I saved 200 places on Google Maps and I have no idea which ones were actually good.

name: Deja Kowalski
life_stage: Couple with no kids, planning every weekend around experiences
relevant_history: Tried a physical journal — beautiful for a month, then abandoned.
emotional_baseline: Optimistic but jaded about apps promising to organize their life
in_their_voice: I rate everything in my head but when someone asks for a rec I blank on half of them.

name: Carmen Russo
life_stage: Remote worker who relocated for lifestyle, discovering local spots
relevant_history: Keeps an Instagram highlights reel of places — looks good but can't remember ratings.
emotional_baseline: Energized — always seeking the next great find
in_their_voice: I screenshot everything and then never look at the screenshots.

name: Marcus Rivera
life_stage: In a long-term relationship, trying to avoid falling into routine
relevant_history: Uses Google Maps saved places extensively but can't remember why they saved half of them.
emotional_baseline: Quietly frustrated that their mental catalog isn't accessible to others
in_their_voice: I've tried Yelp, Google, Instagram saves — none of them are actually my list.

name: Ananya Chowdhury
life_stage: Works in a social job, extends that energy into personal life
relevant_history: Friends screenshot their recs and send them to other people. Has no idea what's circulating.
emotional_baseline: Warm and proactive — texts first, plans first, recommends first
in_their_voice: I know exactly where to send someone based on their vibe but I have to explain it every time.

name: Amir Tanaka
life_stage: Moved in with partner, actively maintaining friendships outside the relationship
relevant_history: Has been asked to start a food blog at least 5 times. Never will.
emotional_baseline: Social battery is high, always looking for the next plan
in_their_voice: I love recommending stuff but I'm tired of repeating myself.

name: Keiko Yamamoto
life_stage: In a big friend group that does monthly themed dinners
relevant_history: Friends text them for recs constantly. Responds from memory, sometimes forgets the best ones.
emotional_baseline: A little scattered — knows tons of places but can't organize them
in_their_voice: I get asked for recs like three times a week and I always forget my best ones in the moment.

name: Rohan Shah
life_stage: Engaged, doing a lot of venue and restaurant scouting
relevant_history: Gives great recs in person but can never remember them when asked over text.
emotional_baseline: Loves the social aspect of discovery more than the tracking
in_their_voice: I'm the group chat planner and honestly I need a better system.

name: Omar Hayes
life_stage: Works nights/weekends, coordinates plans around weird schedules
relevant_history: Has sent the same 'my favorite spots' list to 10+ people. It's always outdated.
emotional_baseline: Getting busier at work, needs recommendations to be low-effort
in_their_voice: I wish I could just send people a link to everything I recommend instead of typing it out every time.

name: Aaliyah Martinez
life_stage: Recently became the default planner in their friend group
relevant_history: Made a shared Google Doc of restaurant recs for friends. Nobody updates it.
emotional_baseline: Confident in their taste, validated constantly by friends
in_their_voice: Someone asked me for my top 10 restaurants and I could only remember 6.

name: Nadia Hoffman
life_stage: Has friends across multiple cities, always recommending places remotely
relevant_history: Texts recommendations one at a time — no central place to point people.
emotional_baseline: Energetic and generous — loves helping people find good stuff
in_their_voice: My recommendations are scattered across 50 text threads.

name: Cedric Cruz
life_stage: Single and social, filling their calendar intentionally
relevant_history: Keeps mental tabs on who likes what and tailors recs by person. Exhausting but natural.
emotional_baseline: Slightly tired of being the unpaid concierge but won't stop
in_their_voice: If there was a way to just share my taste profile I'd send it to everyone.

name: Dante Cooper
life_stage: Big social circle, plans something almost every weekend
relevant_history: Tried creating a group chat for recommendations. It devolved into memes within a week.
emotional_baseline: Fulfilled by connecting people with experiences they love
in_their_voice: I'm not going to write reviews but I'd rank everything if it took two seconds.

name: Rachel Patel
life_stage: The person who always has a restaurant recommendation ready
relevant_history: Used Yelp Collections once, shared the link, nobody clicked it.
emotional_baseline: Happy to help but wishes there was a faster way to share
in_their_voice: I made a shared Google Doc of my favorite restaurants and no one ever looks at it.

name: Megan Nakamura
life_stage: Just turned 30, friend group is splitting between homebodies and still-active
relevant_history: Used to post recs on Instagram stories. Got tired of the performative aspect.
emotional_baseline: Wants credit for their good taste in a non-cringe way
in_their_voice: My friends literally call me their Yelp but I don't have anything written down.

name: Tariq Oduya
life_stage: Living in a new apartment with a great location, hosting often
relevant_history: Tried a shared Notion page with friends. Two people contributed.
emotional_baseline: Always on, always planning — but starting to feel the overhead
in_their_voice: People trust my recs more than any app and I don't even have a system.

name: Tobias Kapoor
life_stage: Burned out on self-improvement tools, wary of new ones
relevant_history: Has an Apple Notes folder called 'Places' with 12 entries across 3 years.
emotional_baseline: Pragmatic — will try it but with zero emotional investment
in_their_voice: I've downloaded like five apps for this. Used each one for a week. They all have 3 entries.

name: Yuki Lee
life_stage: Has strong opinions about app design from all the ones that failed them
relevant_history: Downloaded Day One, Notion, Evernote, and a custom Airtable. All have fewer than 10 entries.
emotional_baseline: Feels guilty about the money spent on premium app trials that went nowhere
in_their_voice: If it doesn't work passively I'm going to forget it exists within a month.

name: Kenji Johansson
life_stage: Currently in a motivated phase but knows it might not last
relevant_history: Tried voice-journaling about experiences. Hated listening to themselves.
emotional_baseline: Genuinely curious if the social angle changes the retention equation
in_their_voice: I'm the person who buys the journal, fills one page, and puts it on a shelf.

name: Jenna Okafor
life_stage: In a phase of optimizing everything — productivity, fitness, now experiences
relevant_history: Started rating restaurants in a spreadsheet during COVID. Abandoned when restaurants reopened.
emotional_baseline: Cautiously interested but leading with skepticism as self-protection
in_their_voice: I know myself — I'll be excited for a week and then forget this exists.

name: Theo Diaz
life_stage: Trying to be more intentional about how they spend time
relevant_history: Bought a beautiful physical journal for tracking experiences. Filled 3 pages.
emotional_baseline: Resigned — expects to fail at this too, but still curious
in_their_voice: My graveyard of abandoned apps is honestly embarrassing.

name: Finn Delgado
life_stage: Organized at work, chaotic in personal life tracking
relevant_history: Created a private Instagram account for experience tracking. Posted 5 times.
emotional_baseline: Motivated in the moment but distrustful of their own follow-through
in_their_voice: I set up an entire Notion system for tracking experiences. I used it exactly twice.

name: Chloe Vasquez
life_stage: Recently moved, using the fresh start to try new systems
relevant_history: Downloaded an app called 'Been' for tracking countries. Fun for travel, useless for daily life.
emotional_baseline: Analytically curious — wants to see if the approach is different enough to stick
in_their_voice: Show me how this is different from the last 4 apps that promised the same thing.

name: Tara Ibrahim
life_stage: Just did a digital declutter and deleted 4 unused apps
relevant_history: Started a Google Maps list of places visited. Has 7 pins from 2022, nothing since.
emotional_baseline: Hopeful but hiding it behind cynicism
in_their_voice: Every January I try a new system. By February it's dead.

name: Camille Bautista
life_stage: Reads about tools and systems more than they use them
relevant_history: Made a New Year's resolution to track experiences. Lasted until January 19th.
emotional_baseline: Self-aware about the pattern and slightly embarrassed by it
in_their_voice: If this takes more than 10 seconds per entry I already know I won't do it.

name: Ethan Bennett
life_stage: Settled into routines, occasionally tries to shake things up
relevant_history: Set up a complex Notion database with ratings, tags, and locations. Used it for 2 weeks.
emotional_baseline: Wants something brain-dead simple because complexity is what kills them
in_their_voice: The last app I tried wanted me to write descriptions. That's when I stopped.

name: Elena Stein
life_stage: Partner teases them about downloading apps they never use
relevant_history: Signed up for a food tracking app, got the premium trial, forgot to cancel, never used it.
emotional_baseline: Defensive — doesn't want to be sold another 'this time it's different' pitch
in_their_voice: I genuinely want to do this but I don't trust myself to keep it up.

name: Miles Owens
life_stage: Has a 'someday' list of experiences that never gets consulted
relevant_history: Tried Yelp check-ins for a month. Felt performative and stopped.
emotional_baseline: Tired of feeling like a quitter when the app is the problem
in_their_voice: I've spent more time setting up tracking systems than actually tracking anything.

name: Kira Petrov
life_stage: Scrolls Instagram and feels like everyone has a more interesting life
relevant_history: Downloads city guide apps before trips, never opens them at home.
emotional_baseline: Motivated by envy more than aspiration — wants to keep up, not lead
in_their_voice: I have like 400 saved posts of places to go and I've been to none of them.

name: Maya Park
life_stage: Follows influencer accounts for city guides but never acts on them
relevant_history: Spent a Saturday researching brunch spots, gave up, and ordered delivery.
emotional_baseline: Emotionally reactive — might download on impulse if the messaging hits
in_their_voice: I keep saying I'll explore more but I end up on the couch every Saturday.

name: Mila Bergström
life_stage: Lives in a great city but keeps going to the same 3 places
relevant_history: Has Google Maps wish-list pins everywhere. Visits none of them.
emotional_baseline: Slightly ashamed of how many weekends they've wasted
in_their_voice: My weekends are forgettable and it's starting to bother me.

name: Nico Brooks
life_stage: Just got out of a relationship, rebuilding their identity around experiences
relevant_history: Went to one cool pop-up, didn't tell anyone, forgot about it.
emotional_baseline: Eager for something that turns passive scrolling into actual plans
in_their_voice: All my friends seem to have this effortless social life and I'm just... here.

name: Soren Lam
life_stage: Has free time but spends it undecided on what to do
relevant_history: Used to go out more in college. Post-grad life feels like a downgrade.
emotional_baseline: Low-key anxious that life is passing by without enough memorable moments
in_their_voice: My Instagram saves are basically a graveyard of things I'll never do.

name: Hana Reyes
life_stage: Has a 'saved' folder on Instagram with 400+ posts they'll never revisit
relevant_history: Tried planning themed weekends. Too much effort for one person.
emotional_baseline: Overwhelmed by options, which paradoxically leads to doing nothing
in_their_voice: I'll spend an hour looking up things to do and then just not go.

name: Joaquin Jensen
life_stage: Single and trying to build a social life that feels curated, not random
relevant_history: Keeps saying 'we should do that' but never follows through.
emotional_baseline: Caught in a scroll-compare-feel-bad loop they're aware of but can't break
in_their_voice: I scroll through my friends' stories and wonder why my life feels so boring.

name: Zoe Fernandez
life_stage: Wants to be spontaneous but ends up overthinking every plan
relevant_history: Follows 'things to do in [city]' accounts but rarely acts on the content.
emotional_baseline: Hopeful that the right tool could unstick them
in_their_voice: I live in one of the best cities in the world and I go to the same three spots.

name: Priya Chang
life_stage: Friend group is active but they often bail and regret it later
relevant_history: Signed up for a local events newsletter. Reads it every week, attends nothing.
emotional_baseline: Feeling behind peers who seem to have effortless, curated lives
in_their_voice: I feel like I'm wasting my twenties not doing enough memorable stuff.

name: Mateo Griffin
life_stage: Moved to a new neighborhood and hasn't explored it yet
relevant_history: Friends post stories from events and they feel left out even when they chose to stay home.
emotional_baseline: Craving structure around their social life without it feeling forced
in_their_voice: I need something that actually makes me DO things, not just save them.

name: Ravi Okonkwo
life_stage: Works demanding hours, weekends feel wasted if not intentional
relevant_history: Made a bucket list in January. Checked off zero items.
emotional_baseline: Wistful — remembers when going out felt easy and fun
in_their_voice: Everyone's always doing something cool and I can't even remember what I did last weekend.

name: Jordan Nguyen
life_stage: Compares their weekends to what they see online and feels behind
relevant_history: Saves Instagram posts of cool places. Has 300+ saves, visited maybe 5.
emotional_baseline: Frustrated that they have the time and money but not the follow-through
in_their_voice: I know about so many cool places but I never actually go to any of them.

name: Samir Novak
life_stage: Second big move in two years, getting better at building from scratch
relevant_history: Has been to dozens of restaurants but couldn't recommend 5 if asked.
emotional_baseline: Craving community and using activities as the way to find it
in_their_voice: I'm saying yes to everything right now but I need a way to sort through what's actually good.

name: Declan Watanabe
life_stage: Moved for a relationship, building an independent social life alongside it
relevant_history: Uses Bumble BFF to meet people. Activities become a blur of first-hangout spots.
emotional_baseline: Slightly anxious about finding 'their' spots before the novelty wears off
in_their_voice: My Google Maps is just a sea of pins and I don't remember why I saved half of them.

name: Iris Torres
life_stage: Moved to a new city 3 months ago, still figuring out their spots
relevant_history: Joined a running club and a book club. Social calendar is full but untracked.
emotional_baseline: Curious and systematic — wants to be intentional about where they go
in_their_voice: Everyone asks if I've found my favorite spots yet and honestly I can't rank any of them.

name: Reese Mensah
life_stage: Digital nomad settling down for 6+ months, wants to actually know a place
relevant_history: Uses Google Maps 'Want to Go' list heavily. It's a mess of 100+ pins with no context.
emotional_baseline: Optimistic and open — in discovery mode, says yes to everything
in_their_voice: I go to meetups and try new spots every week but it's all a blur.

name: Leo Abadi
life_stage: Just moved in with a roommate they found online, exploring together
relevant_history: Asks coworkers for recs and keeps them in a Slack DM. Losing track fast.
emotional_baseline: Eager for tools that help them go from tourist to local
in_their_voice: I've been to 20 restaurants and I could maybe tell you my top 3. Maybe.

name: Simone Baptiste
life_stage: Just moved to a bigger city from a small town, adjusting to the scale
relevant_history: Keeps a running list of recs from locals but it's in 4 different apps.
emotional_baseline: Grateful for the adventure but missing having a go-to crew for plans
in_their_voice: I keep asking people for recs and saving them in 4 different apps. It's chaos.

name: Jasmine Anderson
life_stage: Relocated for a job, knows no one, building social life from zero
relevant_history: Tried 15 coffee shops in the first month. Can't remember which ones were good.
emotional_baseline: Determined to build a better social life than they had in their last city
in_their_voice: Moving to a new city makes you realize how much your taste was just habit.

name: Ingrid Gupta
life_stage: Transferred cities within the same company, has work friends but no local crew
relevant_history: Goes to Meetup events weekly. Has met interesting people but can't keep track of where they went.
emotional_baseline: Energized by newness but worried about forgetting the good stuff
in_their_voice: I've explored more in 3 months than some locals do in years but I have nothing to show for it.

name: Caleb Santos
life_stage: Fresh out of college in a new city, everything feels exciting and overwhelming
relevant_history: Follows local food bloggers and works through their recommendations one by one.
emotional_baseline: Excited but slightly overwhelmed by the pace of new experiences
in_their_voice: I've tried so many places since I moved but I couldn't tell you which ones were actually worth going back to.

name: Noah Malik
life_stage: Living abroad for the first time, exploring aggressively
relevant_history: Explores a new neighborhood every weekend. Takes photos but doesn't organize them.
emotional_baseline: Building a new identity in a new place, experiences are part of that
in_their_voice: I want to build my map of this city but I need a system that isn't just another list.

name: Andre Morales
life_stage: Moved back to the US after years abroad, rediscovering their own country
relevant_history: Started a blog about exploring the new city. Wrote two posts.
emotional_baseline: Lonely but channeling it into exploration energy
in_their_voice: I meet new people through activities every week and I'd love to see what they recommend too.

name: Olivia Dubois
life_stage: Moved for grad school, limited budget but eager to explore
relevant_history: Relies on 'best of' lists from TimeOut/Eater. Found them generic after a few tries.
emotional_baseline: Feels like they're speed-running a city and need to slow down and remember
in_their_voice: I moved here 4 months ago and I still don't have 'a place' — I need to figure out what I actually like here.
